trans-unit.source: Layout containment

Layout is normally scoped to the entire document, which means that if you move one element the entire document needs to be treated as if things could have moved anywhere. By using contain: layout you can tell the browser it only needs to check this element — everything inside the element is scoped to that element and does not affect the rest of the page, and the containing box establishes an independent formatting context.

trans-unit.source: Length unit comparison

Lengths specified as percentages are calculated relative to the initial viewport, which is the viewport before any user agent or authored styles have had an opportunity to adjust the viewport. This is typically based on the size of the window on desktop browsers that aren't in full screen mode.

trans-unit.source: Ligatures (font-variant-ligatures)
trans-unit.target: 连 font-variant-ligatures （font-variant-ligatures）

trans-unit.source: Ligatures are glyphs that replace two or more separate glyphs in order to represent them more smoothly (from a spacing or aesthetic perspective). Some of the most common are letters like 'fi', 'fl', or 'ffl' — but there are many other possibilities. There are the most frequent ones (referred to as common ligatures), and there are also more specialized categories like 'discretionary ligatures', 'historical ligatures', and 'contextual alternates'. While these last ones are not technically ligatures, they are generally similar in that they replace specific combinations of letters when they appear together.
trans-unit.target: 连字是替换两个或多个单独的字形以更平滑地表示它们的字形（从间距或美学角度而言）。一些最常见的字母是诸如“ fi”，“ fl”或“ ffl”之类的字母-但还有许多其他可能性。最常见的类别（称为普通连字），还有更专业的类别，例如“随意连字”，“历史连字”和“上下文替代”。尽管这些最后一个在技术上不是连字，但它们通常相似，因为它们一起出现时会替换字母的特定组合。

trans-unit.source: Like for hidden, the content is clipped to the element's padding box. The difference between clip and hidden is that the clip keyword also forbids all scrolling, including programmatic scrolling. The box is not a scroll container, and does not start a new formatting context. If you wish to start a new formatting context, you can use display: flow-root to do so.

trans-unit.source: Like tables, grid layout enables an author to align elements into columns and rows. However, many more layouts are either possible or easier with CSS grid than they were with tables. For example, a grid container's child elements could position themselves so they actually overlap and layer, similar to CSS positioned elements.
trans-unit.target: 像表格一样,网格布局使作者能够将元素排列成列和行。然而,与表格相比,CSS网格还有更多的布局是可能的或更容易的。例如,网格容器的子元素可以定位自己,使它们实际上重叠和分层,类似于CSS定位元素。

trans-unit.source: Like the hidden keyword, displays no border. Unless a background-image is set, the calculated value of border-top-width will be 0, even if the specified value is something else. In the case of table cell and border collapsing, the none value has the lowest priority: if any other conflicting border is set, it will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: 与 hidden 关键字一样，不显示边框。除非设置了 background-image ，否则即使指定的值是其他值， border-top-width 的计算值也将为 0 。在表格单元格和边框折叠的情况下， none 值的优先级最低：如果设置了任何其他冲突的边框，它将显示出来。

trans-unit.source: Like the hidden keyword, displays no border. Unless a background-image is set, the computed value of the same side's border-width will be 0, even if the specified value is something else. In the case of table cell and border collapsing, the none value has the lowest priority: if any other conflicting border is set, it will be displayed.

Like the none keyword, displays no border. Unless a background-image is set, the calculated value of border-top-width will be 0, even if the specified value is something else. In the case of table cell and border collapsing, the hidden value has the highest priority: if any other conflicting border is set, it won't be displayed.
trans-unit.target: 与 none 关键字一样，不显示边框。除非设置了 background-image ，否则即使指定的值是其他值， border-top-width 的计算值也将为 0 。在表格单元格和边框折叠的情况下， hidden 值具有最高优先级：如果设置了任何其他冲突的边框，则不会显示该值。

trans-unit.source: Like the none keyword, displays no border. Unless a background-image is set, the computed value of the same side's border-width will be 0, even if the specified value is something else. In the case of table cell and border collapsing, the hidden value has the highest priority: if any other conflicting border is set, it won't be displayed.

Like the non-repeating conic gradient, the color-stops are placed around a gradient arc -- the circumference of a circle, rather than on the gradient line emerging from the center of the gradient. The colors transition as as if spun around the center of a circle, starting at the top if no from <angle> is declared, and going clockwise for the the size of the angle that is the different between the largest and smallest color angle, then repeating.

trans-unit.source: Logical Properties & Values

trans-unit.source: Logical Properties and Values
trans-unit.target: 逻辑属性和数值

trans-unit.source: Logical Properties and Values can be thought of as a couple of groups in terms of current browser support. Some of the properties are essentially mappings from the physical versions, for example inline-size for width or margin-inline-start rather than margin-left. These mapped properties are starting to see good browser support, and if you look at the individual pages for the properties in the reference here on MDN you will see that Edge is the only modern browser currently missing these.
trans-unit.target: 就当前的浏览器支持而言，逻辑属性和值可以看作是两个组。一些属性本质上是物理版本的映射，例如 inline-size 表示 width 或 margin-inline-start 而不是 margin-left 。这些映射的属性开始获得良好的浏览器支持，如果您在MDN上的参考文献中查看属性的各个页面，则会发现Edge是当前缺少这些属性的唯一现代浏览器。

trans-unit.source: Logical properties and values do not make an assumption about text direction. Which is why in Grid Layout we use the keyword start when aligning something to the start of the container. For me, working in English, start may well be on the left, however it doesn’t have to be, and the word start infers no physical location.
trans-unit.target: 逻辑属性和值不假设有关文本方向。这就是为什么在Grid Layout中将某些内容与容器的开头对齐时使用关键字 start 的原因。对我来说，用英语工作， start 很可能在左边，但不一定必须在左边， start 这个词并不表示实际位置。

trans-unit.source: Logical properties and values use the abstract terms block and inline to describe the direction in which they flow. The physical meaning of these terms depends on the writing mode.
trans-unit.target: 逻辑属性和值使用抽象术语“ 块”和“ 内联”来描述它们流动的方向。这些术语的物理含义取决于书写方式。

trans-unit.source: Logical properties for everything!
trans-unit.target: 一切的逻辑属性!

trans-unit.source: Make an element look like a menulist button

Make sure the visual focus indicator can be seen by people with low vision. This will also benefit anyone use a screen in a brightly lit space (like outside in the sun). WCAG 2.1 SC 1.4.11 Non-Text Contrast requires that the visual focus indicator be at least 3 to 1.
trans-unit.target: 确保弱视人群可以看到视觉焦点指示器。这也将有益于在明亮的空间（如阳光下）使用屏幕的任何人。WCAG 2.1 SC 1.4.11非文本对比度要求视觉焦点指示器至少为3比1。

trans-unit.source: Make the first letter of every paragraph red and big.
trans-unit.target: 把每段的第一个字母都写成红色的大字。

trans-unit.source: Make your animation as self-contained as possible. This means you should not rely on animation-direction: alternate. Instead you should explicitly write a keyframe animation that goes through the full animation in one forward repetition.
trans-unit.target: 使您的动画尽可能独立。这意味着您不应该依赖 animation-direction: alternate 。相反，您应该显式编写一个关键帧动画，并以一个向前重复的方式遍历整个动画。

trans-unit.source: Mandatory <input>s should have the required attribute applied to them. This will ensure that people navigating with the aid of assistive technology such as a screen reader will be able to understand which inputs need valid content to ensure a successful submission.

trans-unit.source: Many JavaScript frameworks and libraries add inline styles. Using !important with a very targeted selector is one way to override these inline styles.

Many designers find HSL more intuitive than RGB, since it allows hue, saturation, and lightness to each be adjusted independently. HSL can also make it easier to create a set of matching colors (such as when you want multiple shades of a single hue).
trans-unit.target: 许多设计师发现HSL比RGB更直观,因为它允许独立调整每一个色相、饱和度和明度。HSL还可以更容易地创建一组匹配的颜色(例如当你想要一个单一色调的多个色调时)。

trans-unit.source: Many developers believe that the containing block of an element is always the content area of its parent, but that isn't necessarily true. Let's investigate the factors that determine what an element's containing block is.
trans-unit.target: 很多开发者认为,一个元素的包含块总是其父元素的内容区域,但这并不一定正确。让我们来研究一下决定一个元素的包含块是什么的因素。

trans-unit.source: Many layouts are essentially sets of “cards” – product listings, image galleries, and so on. A grid can make it very easy to create these listings in a way that is responsive without needing to add media queries to make it so. In this next example I’m combining CSS Grid and Flexbox Layouts to make a simple product listing layout.
trans-unit.target: 实际上，许多布局都是“卡片”的集合-产品清单，图像画廊等等。网格可以很容易地以响应方式创建这些列表，而无需添加媒体查询。在下一个示例中，我将结合CSS网格和Flexbox布局来制作简单的产品列表布局。

trans-unit.source: Many media features are range features, which means they can be prefixed with "min-" or "max-" to express "minimum condition" or "maximum condition" constraints. For example, this CSS will apply styles only if your browser's viewport width is equal to or narrower than 12450px:
trans-unit.target: 许多媒体功能都是范围功能，这意味着可以在它们前面加上“最小”或“最大”来表示“最小条件”或“最大条件”约束。例如，仅当您的浏览器的视口宽度等于或小于12450px时，此CSS才会应用样式：

trans-unit.source: Many of the basic font properties (such as font-weight and font-style) are well-supported across browsers, but some of the newer features still have more limited support. For the full story you'll have to look at the browser compatibility information on the individual reference pages.
trans-unit.target: 许多基本字体属性（例如 font-weight 和 font-style ）在浏览器中都得到很好的支持，但是某些较新的功能仍然支持有限。有关完整的故事，您必须查看各个参考页面上的浏览器兼容性信息。

trans-unit.source: Many of the grid examples you will find online make the assumption that you will use grid for main page layout, however grid can be just as useful for small elements as those larger ones. Using grid-template-areas can be especially nice as it is easy to see in the code what your element looks like.
trans-unit.target: 您在网上可以找到的许多网格示例均假设您将网格用于主页布局，但是网格对于较小的元素和较大的元素一样有用。使用 grid-template-areas 可能特别好，因为在代码中很容易看到元素的外观。

trans-unit.source: Many webpages contain a number of sections which are independent of each other. For example a listing of article headlines and content, as in the mark-up below.

Many websites are a variation of this type of layout, with content, sidebars, a header and a footer. In a responsive design, you may want to display the layout as a single column, adding a sidebar at a certain breakpoint and then bring in a three-column layout for wider screens.
trans-unit.target: 许多网站都是这种类型布局的变体,有内容、侧栏、页眉和页脚。在响应式设计中,你可能希望以单列的方式显示布局,在某个断点处添加侧栏,然后为更宽的屏幕引入三列布局。

trans-unit.source: Masking an image
Masonry Layout

Masonry layout is a layout method where one axis uses a typical strict grid layout, of most often columns, and the other a masonry layout. On the masonry axis, rather than sticking to a strict grid with gaps being left after shorter items, the items in the following row rise up to completely fill the gaps.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Viewports
trans-unit.target: 移动视口

trans-unit.source: Mobile devices comes in all <s>shapes and</s> sizes, with screens of differing device pixel ratios. The mobile browser's viewport is the area of the window in which web content can be seen, which is not necessarily the same size as the rendered page. Mobile browsers render pages in a virtual window or viewport, generally at 960px, which is usually wider than the screen, and then shrink the rendered result down so it can all be seen at once. Users can then pan and zoom to see different areas of the page. For example, if a mobile screen has a width of 320px, a website might be rendered with a virtual viewport of 960px, and then it will be shrunk down to fit into the 320px space, which, depending on the design, is illegible for many if not everyone. To tell a mobile browser to use the viewport width instead of the default 960px as the width of the screen, developers should include a viewport meta tag, like the following:
trans-unit.target: 移动设备有各种<s>形状，</s>尺寸，以及不同设备像素比率的屏幕。移动浏览器的视口是窗口中可以看到Web内容的区域，不一定与呈现的页面大小相同。移动浏览器在虚拟窗口或视口中渲染页面，通常为960px，通常比屏幕宽，然后将渲染结果缩小，以便可以一次看到所有内容。然后，用户可以平移和缩放以查看页面的不同区域。例如，如果移动屏幕的宽度为320像素，则可以使用960像素的虚拟视口渲染网站，然后将其缩小以适合320像素的空间，这取决于设计，对于许多人来说是难以辨认的如果不是每个人。要告诉移动浏览器使用视口宽度而不是默认的960px作为屏幕宽度，开发人员应包括一个视口元标记，如下所示：

More recently we have gained CSS Grid Layout and Flexbox. To access these we also use values of the display property — display: grid and display: flex. Only when the value of display is changed do the children become flex or grid items and begin to respond to the other properties in the grid or flexbox specifications. Changing an element's display value changes the formatting context of its direct children.

trans-unit.source: Most of the time, absolutely positioned elements that have height and width set to auto are sized so as to fit their contents. However, non-replaced, absolutely positioned elements can be made to fill the available vertical space by specifying both top and bottom and leaving height unspecified (that is, auto). They can likewise be made to fill the available horizontal space by specifying both left and right and leaving width as auto.
trans-unit.target: 大多数情况下，将 height 和 width 设置为 auto 的绝对定位元素的大小调整为适合其内容的大小。但是，可以通过指定 top 和 bottom 并且不指定 height （即 auto ）来使未替换的，绝对定位的元素填充可用的垂直空间。同样，可以通过指定 left 和 right 并将 width 保留为 auto 来填充可用的水平空间。

trans-unit.source: Most standard Western fonts include italic and bold variants, but many novelty fonts do not. Fonts used for Chinese, Japanese, Korean and other logographic scripts tend not to include these variants, and synthesizing them may impede the legibility of the text. In these cases, it may be desirable to switch off the browser's default font-synthesis.
trans-unit.target: 大多数标准的西方字体都包括斜体和粗体变体,但许多新式字体却不包括这些变体。用于中文、日文、韩文和其他逻辑文字的字体往往不包括这些变体,而合成这些变体可能会妨碍文本的可读性。在这些情况下,最好关闭浏览器的默认字体合成功能。

trans-unit.source: Mozilla extensions

Much like the values of properties, each at-rule has a different syntax. Nevertheless, several of them can be grouped into a special category named conditional group rules. These statements share a common syntax and each of them can include nested statements—either rulesets or nested at-rules. Furthermore, they all convey a common semantic meaning—they all link some type of condition, which at any time evaluates to either true or false. If the condition evaluates to true, then all of the statements within the group will be applied.
trans-unit.target: 就像属性的值一样，每个规则都有不同的语法。不过，其中的一些可以分组为一个特殊的类别，称为条件分组规则。这些声明都有一个共同的语法和他们每个人可以包括嵌套语句 -或者规则集或嵌套的规则。此外，它们都传达一种共同的语义-它们都链接某种类型的条件，该条件在任何时候都可以评估为true或false。如果条件评估为true，则将应用组中的所有语句。

trans-unit.source: Much of the information about the visual formatting model is defined in CSS2, however, various level 3 specifications have added to this information. trans-unit.source: New layout methods such as Flexbox and Grid bring with them the possibility of controlling the order of content. In this article we will take a look at ways in which you can change the visual order of your content when using Flexbox. We will also consider the implications of reordering items from an accessibility point of view.
trans-unit.target: Flexbox和Grid等新的布局方法带来了控制内容顺序的可能性。在这篇文章中,我们将看看在使用Flexbox时,您可以改变内容的视觉顺序的方法。我们还将从可访问性的角度考虑重新安排项目顺序的影响。

trans-unit.source: Normal (Regular)

Normal Flow is defined in the CSS 2.1 specification, which explains that any boxes in normal flow will be part of a formatting context. They can be either block or inline, but not both at once. We describe block-level boxes as participating in a block formatting context, and inline-level boxes as participating in an inline formatting context.
trans-unit.target: CSS 2.1规范中定义了Normal Flow，该规范解释了Normal Flow中的任何框都将成为格式化上下文的一部分。它们可以是块或内联，但不能同时存在。我们将块级框描述为参与块格式化上下文，而将行内框描述为参与内联格式化上下文。

trans-unit.source: Not all cubic Bézier curves are suitable as easing functions as not all are mathematical functions; i.e., curves that for a given abscissa have zero or one value. With P0 and P3 fixed as defined by CSS, a cubic Bézier curve is a function, and is therefore valid, if and only if the abscissas of P1 and P2 are both in the [0, 1] range.

Not all cubic Bézier curves are suitable as timing functions as not all are mathematical functions; i.e., curves that for a given abscissa have zero or one value. With P0 and P3 fixed as defined by CSS, a cubic Bézier curve is a function, and is therefore valid, if and only if the abscissas of P1 and P2 are both in the [0, 1] range.
trans-unit.target: 并不是所有的三次Bézier曲线都适合作为计时函数，因为并非都是数学函数 ; 即，对于给定的横坐标，曲线的值为零或一个。在CSS定义的P 0和P 3固定的情况下，三次贝塞尔曲线是一个函数，因此，当且仅当P 1和P 2的横坐标都在 [0, 1] 范围内时，该曲线才有效。

Note that preventing an element from being the target of mouse events by using pointer-events does not necessarily mean that mouse event listeners on that element cannot or will not be triggered. If one of the element's children has pointer-events explicitly set to allow that child to be the target of mouse events, then any events targeting that child will pass through the parent as the event travels along the parent chain, and trigger event listeners on the parent as appropriate. Of course any mouse activity at a point on the screen that is covered by the parent but not by the child will not be caught by either the child or the parent (it will go "through" the parent and target whatever is underneath).
trans-unit.target: 需要注意的是防止元件因使用被鼠标事件的目标 pointer-events 也并不一定意味着该元素的鼠标事件监听器不能或不会被触发。如果元素的子元素之一具有明确设置为允许的 pointer-events 该子对象将成为鼠标事件的目标，则当该事件沿父对象链传播时，以该子对象为目标的所有事件都将通过父对象，并在适当时触发父对象上的事件侦听器。当然，在屏幕上被父对象而不是孩子覆盖的某个点上的任何鼠标活动都不会被孩子或父对象捕获（它将“穿过”父对象并瞄准下面的任何对象）。

Of course any pointer activity at a point on the screen that is covered by the parent but not by the child will not be caught by either the child or the parent (it will go "through" the parent and target whatever is underneath).

trans-unit.source: Notice the repetition in the CSS. The background color is set to brown in several places. For some CSS declarations, it is possible to declare this higher in the cascade and let CSS inheritance solve this problem naturally. For non-trivial projects, this is not always possible. By declaring a custom property on the :root pseudo-class and using it where needed throughout the document, a CSS author can reduce the need for repetition:

Notice the repetition in the CSS. The background color is set to brown in several places. For some CSS declarations, it is possible to declare this higher in the cascade and let CSS inheritance solve this problem naturally. For non-trivial projects, this is not always possible. By declaring a variable on the :root pseudo-class, a CSS author can reduce the need for repetition by using the variable.
trans-unit.target: 注意CSS中的重复。在某些地方，背景色设置为 brown 。对于某些CSS声明，可以在级联中声明更高的位置，并让CSS继承自然解决此问题。对于非平凡的项目，这并不总是可能的。通过在 :root 伪类上声明一个变量，CSS编写者可以通过使用该变量来减少重复的需要。

trans-unit.source: Now that we have seen how alignment works on the cross axis, we can take a look at the main axis. Here we only have one property available to us — justify-content. This is because we are only dealing with items as a group on the main axis. With justify-content we control what happens with available space, should there be more space than is needed to display the items.

Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

trans-unit.source: On a desktop computer, for example, the MouseEvent.clientX and MouseEvent.clientY properties indicate the position of the mouse cursor at the moment the event occurred, relative to the top-left corner of the browser window. The top-left corner of the window is always (0, 0), regardless of the content of the document or any scrolling that may have been done. In other words, scrolling the document will change the client coordinates of a given position within the document.
trans-unit.target: 例如，在台式计算机上， MouseEvent.clientX 和 MouseEvent.clientY 属性指示事件发生时鼠标光标相对于浏览器窗口左上角的位置。窗口的左上角始终为（0，0），而不管文档的内容或可能进行的任何滚动。换句话说，滚动文档将更改文档中给定位置的客户坐标。

trans-unit.source: On elements, always computes to normal. On ::before and ::after, if normal is specified, computes to none. Otherwise, for URI values, the absolute URI; for attr() values, the resulting string; for other keywords, as specified.
trans-unit.target: 在元素上，总是计算为 normal 。在 ::before 和 ::after 上，如果指定 normal ，则计算为 none 。否则，对于URI值，则为绝对URI；否则，为URI。对于 attr() 值，结果字符串；指定的其他关键字。

On macOS, you need to set the General > Show scroll bars setting in System Preferences to "Always" for this property to have any effect.

On mobile devices (or desktop devices that are in full screen mode), the initial viewport is usually the portion of a device's screen that is available for application use. This may be either the full screen or the full screen area minus areas controlled by the operating system (such as a taskbar) or the application-available screen area (either the full screen or the screen minus any areas owned by the operating system or other applications).
trans-unit.target: 在移动设备上(或全屏模式的桌面设备上),初始视口通常是设备屏幕上可供应用使用的部分,可能是全屏或全屏区域减去操作系统控制的区域(如任务栏),也可能是应用可用的屏幕区域(全屏或屏幕减去操作系统拥有的任何区域)。这可能是全屏或全屏区域减去由操作系统控制的区域(如任务栏),或者是应用程序可用的屏幕区域(全屏或屏幕减去由操作系统或其他应用程序拥有的任何区域)。

trans-unit.source: On narrow screens such as smartphones, the width of search boxes and other form fields can get drastically shortened. This can result in their placeholder text getting cropped in an undesirable way. It is often useful to alter this behavior with the text-overflow property.
trans-unit.target: 在智能手机等狭窄的屏幕上，搜索框和其他表单字段的宽度会大大缩短。这可能导致其占位符文本以不希望的方式被裁剪。使用 text-overflow 属性更改此行为通常很有用。

trans-unit.source: On screens, the units are related to CSS inches, centimeters, or pixels, not physical values.
trans-unit.target: 在屏幕上，单位与CSS英寸，厘米或像素有关，而不是物理值。

trans-unit.source: On the ::before and ::after pseudo elements, the computed value is none
trans-unit.target: 在 ::before 和 ::after 伪元素上，计算出的值为 none

On the Mozilla Developer YouTube Channel, see the videos Laying out forms using subgrid and Don't Wait To Use Subgrid For Better Card Layouts
On the cross axis align-self makes sense as we potentially have additional space in the flex container in that dimension, in which a single item can be moved to the start and end.
trans-unit.target: 在横轴上 align-self 是有意义的，因为我们可能会在弹性容器中在该维度上留出额外的空间，在其中可以将单个项目移动到起点和终点。

trans-unit.source: On the cross axis the row-gap property will create spacing between adjacent flex lines, therefore flex-wrap must also be set to wrap for this to have any effect.
trans-unit.target: 在横轴上， row-gap 属性将在相邻的折弯线之间创建间距，因此，还必须将 flex-wrap 设置为 wrap ，以使其生效。

trans-unit.source: On the grid axis, things will work just as you expect them to in grid layout. You can cause items to span multiple tracks while remaining in auto-placement, using the span keyword. Items may also be positioned using line-based positioning.
On the inline axis, we can use justify-content to perform the same type of alignment that we used align-content for in the block axis.
trans-unit.target: 在内联轴上，我们可以使用 justify-content 来执行与在块轴中使用 align-content 相同的对齐方式。

trans-unit.source: On the main axis Flexbox deals with our content as a group. The amount of space required to lay out the items is calculated, and the leftover space is then available for distribution. The justify-content property controls how that leftover space is used. Set justify-content: flex-end and the extra space is placed before the items, justify-content: space-around and it is placed either side of the item in that dimension, etc.
trans-unit.target: 在主轴上，Flexbox作为一个整体来处理我们的内容。计算出布置物品所需的空间量，然后剩余的空间可用于分配。该 justify-content 属性控制剩余空间的使用。设置 justify-content: flex-end 并在项目之前放置多余的空间， justify-content: space-around 并将其放置在该维度中项目的两侧，依此类推。

trans-unit.source: On the main axis, Flexbox deals with our content as a group. The amount of space required to lay out the items is calculated, and the leftover space is then available for distribution. The justify-content property controls how that leftover space is used. Set justify-content: flex-end and the extra space is placed before the items, justify-content: space-around and it is placed either side of the item in that dimension, etc.
On the main axis, the column-gap property will create fixed size gaps between adjacent items.
trans-unit.target: 在主轴上， column-gap 属性将在相邻项目之间创建固定大小的间隙。

trans-unit.source: On the other end of the spectrum, you can scale an image up in the background. Here we scale a 32x32 pixel favicon to 300x300 pixels:
trans-unit.target: 在光谱的另一端,你可以在背景中放大图像。在这里,我们将一个32x32像素的favicon缩放为300x300像素。

trans-unit.source: On the other hand, if a true italicized version of the font family exists, we can include it in the src descriptor and specify the font style as italic, so that it is clear that the font is italicized. True italics use different glyphs and are a bit different from their upright counterparts, having some unique features and generally have a rounded and calligraphic quality. These fonts are specially created by font designers and are not artificially sloped.
trans-unit.target: 另一方面，如果存在字体家族的真实斜体版本，则可以将其包含在 src 描述符中，并将字体样式指定为斜体，这样很显然字体是斜体的。真正的斜体使用不同的字形，并且与直立的斜体有些不同，它们具有一些独特的功能，并且通常具有圆形和书法的质量。这些字体是由字体设计师专门创建的，没有人为倾斜。

trans-unit.source: On the other hand, if a true italicized version of the font family exists, we can include it in the src descriptor and specify the font style as italic, so that it is clear that the font is italicized. True italics use different glyphs and are a bit different from their upright counterparts, having some unique features and generally have a rounded and calligraphic quality. These fonts are specially created by font designers and are not artificially sloped.

On the web, the default origin is the top-left corner of a given context (with positive y-coordinate values being below the origin). Note that this is unlike most mathematical models, where the origin is at the bottom-left corner, with positive y-coordinate values being above the origin.
trans-unit.target: 在网络上，默认的原点是顶给定情景的-left角落（正Y坐标值是原点下文）。请注意，这是不同于大多数的数学模型，其中原点在底部 -左拐角处，正y坐标值的原点上方。

trans-unit.source: Once again I can use feature queries to overwrite a layout that uses display: inline-block, and again I don’t need to overwrite everything. An item that is set to inline-block becomes a grid item, and so the behaviour of inline-block no longer applies. I have used the vertical-align property on my item when in the inline-block display mode, but this property does not apply to grid items and, therefore, is ignored once the item becomes a grid item:
trans-unit.target: 再一次，我可以使用功能查询来覆盖使用 display: inline-block 的布局，再次，我不需要覆盖所有内容。设置为 inline-block 的项目将成为网格项目，因此 inline-block 的行为不再适用。 inline-block 显示模式下，我在项目上使用了 vertical-align 属性，但是此属性不适用于网格项目，因此，一旦该项目成为网格项目，该属性将被忽略：

trans-unit.source: Once again it is the width on the item we need to address, and then any other properties we want to enhance. In this example I have again used gap, rather than margins and negative margins to create my gutters.

Once again it is the width on the item we need to address, and then any other properties we want to enhance. In this example I have again used grid-gap, rather than margins and negative margins to create my gutters.
trans-unit.target: 同样，它是我们需要处理的项目的宽度，然后是我们要增强的任何其他属性。在此示例中，我再次使用 grid-gap ，而不是使用边距和负边距来创建我的装订线。

trans-unit.source: Once again the Grid Inspector is useful to help us see how our layout has taken shape.
trans-unit.target: 网格检查器再次有助于我们了解布局的形状。

trans-unit.source: Once again the default is stretch, other than for items with an intrinsic aspect ratio. This means that by default, grid items will cover their grid area, unless you change that by setting alignment. The first item in the example demonstrates this default alignment:
trans-unit.target: 再次将默认值设置为 stretch ，但对于具有固有长宽比的项目除外。这意味着默认情况下，网格项目将覆盖其网格区域，除非您通过设置对齐方式进行更改。示例中的第一项演示了此默认对齐方式：

trans-unit.source: Once again the item no longer participates in the grid layout in terms of sizing or when other items are auto-placed.
trans-unit.target: 再次,该项目不再参与网格布局的大小或其他项目自动放置时。

trans-unit.source: Once again we can switch our flex-direction to column in order to see how this property behaves when we are working by column. As before, we need enough space in the cross axis to have some free space after displaying all of the items.
trans-unit.target: 再一次，我们可以将 flex-direction 切换到 column ，以查看按列工作时此属性的行为。和以前一样，在显示所有项目后，我们需要在横轴上有足够的空间以具有一些可用空间。

trans-unit.source: Once again, the grid highlighter is helpful to show us how the grid we have placed our items on works.
trans-unit.target: 再次,网格高亮显示器很有帮助,可以向我们展示我们放置物品的网格是如何工作的。

trans-unit.source: Once an inline-block item becomes a flex item, it is blockified and so behavior of display: inline-block like preserving white space between items no longer applies.
trans-unit.target: 一旦 inline-block 项目变为弹性项目，就对其进行 block ，因此 display: inline-block 行为：内联块（如保留项目之间的空白）不再适用。

trans-unit.source: Once forced breaks have been applied, soft breaks may be added if needed, but not on element boundaries that resolve in a corresponding avoid value.

Once the element has loaded, changing the value of this property has no effect.

trans-unit.source: Once this code is finished running, the value of animation will be false if CSS animation support isn't available, or it will be true. If it is true then both the animation property name and the keyframe prefix will be the right ones. So if you use a new Firefox, the property will be MozAnimation and the keyframe prefix -moz- and with Chrome it'll be WebkitAnimation and -webkit-. Notice browsers don't make it easy with the switching between camelCase and hyphen-ation.
trans-unit.target: 此代码运行完毕后，如果CSS动画支持不可用，animation 的值将为 false ，否则将为 true 。如果为 true ,则动画属性名称和关键帧前缀都将是正确的。因此，如果您使用新的Firefox，则该属性将为 MozAnimation ，关键帧前缀 -moz- ,而对于Chrome，它将为 WebkitAnimation 和 -webkit- 。请注意，浏览器无法在camelCase和连字符之间进行切换。

trans-unit.source: Once we begin dealing with logical, rather than physical properties, we stop seeing the world as left to right, and top to bottom. We need a new reference point, and this is where understanding the block and inline axes, that we met previously in the guide to alignment, becomes very useful. If you can start to see layout in terms of block and inline, the way things work in grid start to make a lot more sense.
trans-unit.target: 一旦开始处理逻辑属性，而不是物理属性，我们便不再从左到右，从上到下看到世界。我们需要一个新的参考点，在这里，我们在对齐指南中先前遇到的理解块轴和内联轴变得非常有用。如果您可以从块和内联的角度开始看到布局，那么网格中的工作方式就会变得更加有意义。

trans-unit.source: Once you are working in writing modes other than horizontal-tb many of the properties and values that are mapped to the physical dimensions of the screen seem strange. For example, if you give a box a width of 100px, in horizontal-tb that would control the size in the inline direction. In vertical-lr it controls the size in the block direction because it does not rotate with the text.
trans-unit.target: 一旦您在除 horizontal-tb 以外的其他书写模式下工作，映射到屏幕物理尺寸的许多属性和值似乎很奇怪。例如，如果您给框设置了100px的宽度，则为 horizontal-tb ，它将控制内联方向的大小。在 vertical-lr 中,它控制块方向的大小，因为它不会随文本一起旋转。

trans-unit.source: Once you’ve configured the animation’s timing, you need to define the appearance of the animation. This is done by establishing two or more keyframes using the @keyframes at-rule. Each keyframe describes how the animated element should render at a given time during the animation sequence.
trans-unit.target: 配置了动画的时间后，您需要定义动画的外观。这是通过使用 @keyframes 规则建立两个或更多关键帧来完成的。每个关键帧描述动画元素在动画序列中给定时间应如何呈现。

One of the more common use cases for OpenType features is proper small caps. These are capital letters sized to fit better amongst lower case letters and are generally used for acronyms and abbreviations.
trans-unit.target: OpenType功能的一个比较常见的使用情况是适当的小写字母。这些大写字母的大小是为了更好地适应小写字母,通常用于缩写和缩略语。

trans-unit.source: One of the most common style changes made to lists is a change in the indentation distance—that is, how far the list items are pushed over to the right. This often leads to frustration, because what works in one browser often doesn't have the same effect in another. For example, if you declare that lists have no left margin, they move over in Internet Explorer, but sit stubbornly in place in Gecko-based browsers.This article will help you understand the problems that can occur and how to avoid them.
trans-unit.target: 对列表进行的最常见的样式更改之一是缩进距离的更改，即缩进列表项到右侧的距离。这通常会导致挫败感，因为在一种浏览器中正常工作的结果在另一种浏览器中往往没有相同的效果。例如，如果您声明列表没有左页边距，它们将在Internet Explorer中移动，但是在基于Gecko的浏览器中固执地坐在原处。本文将帮助您了解可能出现的问题以及如何避免它们。

trans-unit.source: One of the reasons that flexbox quickly caught the interest of web developers is that it brought proper alignment capabilities to the web for the first time. It enabled proper vertical alignment, so we can at last easily center a box. In this guide, we will take a thorough look at how the alignment and justification properties work in Flexbox.

One of the reasons that flexbox quickly caught the interest of web developers is that it brought proper alignment capabilities to the web for the first time. It enabled proper vertical alignment, so we can at last easily centre a box. In this guide, we will take a thorough look at how the alignment and justification properties work in Flexbox.
trans-unit.target: flexbox迅速引起网页开发者的兴趣,原因之一是它第一次为网页带来了正确的对齐功能。它实现了适当的垂直对齐,所以我们终于可以轻松地将一个盒子居中。在本指南中,我们将全面了解Flexbox中的对齐和正当性属性是如何工作的。

trans-unit.source: Only CSS declarations, that is property/value pairs, participate in the cascade. This means that at-rules containing entities other than declarations, such as a @font-face rule containing descriptors, don't participate in the cascade. In these cases, only the at-rule as a whole participates in the cascade: here, the @font-face identified by its font-family descriptor. If several @font-face rules with the same descriptor are defined, only the most appropriate @font-face, as a whole, is considered.
trans-unit.target: 只有CSS声明（即属性/值对）参与级联。这意味着包含除声明以外的实体的规则（例如，包含描述符的 @font-face 规则）不参与级联。在这些情况下，只有整个规则才参与级联：这里，由其 font-family 描述符标识的 @font-face 。如果定义了多个具有相同描述符的 @font-face 规则，则整体上仅考虑最合适的 @font-face 。

trans-unit.source: Only a few elements (<li> and <summary>) have a default value of display: list-item. trans-unit.target: 只有几个元素（ <li> 和 <summary> ）的缺省值为 display: list-item 。但是， list-style-type 属性可以应用于 display 值设置为 list-item 的任何元素。此外，由于此属性是继承的，因此可以在父元素（通常为 <ol> 或 <ul> ）上进行设置，以使其应用于所有列表项。

trans-unit.source: Only the individual properties values can inherit. As missing values are replaced by their initial value, it is impossible to allow inheritance of individual properties by omitting them. The keyword inherit can be applied to a property, but only as a whole, not as a keyword for one value or another. That means that the only way to make some specific value to be inherited is to use the longhand property with the keyword inherit.
trans-unit.target: 仅单个属性值可以继承。由于缺失值被其初始值替代，因此不可能通过忽略它们来继承单个属性。关键字 inherit 可以应用于属性，但只能应用于整个属性，不能应用于一个值或另一个值的关键字。这意味着要使某些特定值被继承的唯一方法是将longhand属性与关键字 inherit 。

trans-unit.source: Only the subset of CSS properties that apply to the ::first-line pseudo-element can be used in a rule using ::placeholder in its selector.
trans-unit.target: 在规则中使用 ::placeholder 的规则中，仅适用于 ::first-line 伪元素的CSS属性的子集。

trans-unit.source: Opera 22 added Windows support.
Opera 52 stopped creating layout objects for elements inside an <iframe> with display:none applied.
Opera 9.5 to 10.1 adheres to the old, reverse painting order (in CSS2, the first specified shadow is on the bottom).
trans-unit.target: Opera 9.5到10.1坚持旧的、反向的绘画顺序(在CSS2中,第一个指定的阴影在底部)。

trans-unit.source: Opera 9.5's computation of the background positioning area is incorrect for fixed backgrounds. Opera 9.5 also interprets the two-value form as a horizontal scaling factor and, from appearances, a vertical clipping dimension. This has been fixed in Opera 10.
trans-unit.target: Opera 9.5对固定背景的背景定位区域的计算是不正确的。Opera 9.5还将两值形式解释为水平缩放因子,从外观上看,解释为垂直剪裁维度。这一点在Opera 10中已经得到了修正。

trans-unit.source: Opera Android 47 stopped creating layout objects for elements inside an <iframe> with display:none applied.
Opera accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.
Opera also continues to support the prefixed versions.
Opera does not print backgrounds of the <body> element. If this property is set to exact for the <body> element, it will apply only to its descendants.

trans-unit.source: Opera supports a maximum of 6-9 text-shadows for performance reasons. The blur radius is limited to 100px.

trans-unit.source: Opera supports the collapse value only on <tr>, <thead>, <tbody>, and <tfoot>, but not on <col> and <colgroup> elements.
Opera treats auto as optimizeSpeed.
Opera treats visibility: collapse like hidden, leaving a white gap.
Opera uses auto as the initial value for min-width.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, a <color> value.

Optionally, it may be preceded by a single + or - sign. Positive numbers represent clockwise angles, while negative numbers represent counterclockwise angles. For static properties of a given unit, any angle can be represented by various equivalent values. For example, 90deg equals -270deg, and 1turn equals 4turn. For dynamic properties, like when applying an animation or transition, the effect will nevertheless be different.

trans-unit.source: Other formatting contexts also create anonymous boxes. Grid Layout behaves in the same way as the flexbox example above, turning strings of text into a grid item with an anonymous box. Multiple-column layout creates anonymous column boxes around the columns; these also cannot be styled or otherwise targetted. Table layout will add anonymous boxes to create a proper table structure — for example adding an anonymous table row — if there was no box with display: table-row.

trans-unit.source: Other than in Internet Explorer, CSS Grid Layout is unprefixed in Safari, Chrome, Opera, Firefox and Edge. Support for all the properties and values detailed in these guides is interoperable across browsers. This means that if you write some Grid Layout code in Firefox, it should work in the same way in Chrome. This is no longer an experimental specification, and you are safe to use it in production.
trans-unit.target: 除了在Internet Explorer中,CSS Grid Layout在Safari、Chrome、Opera、Firefox和Edge中是不固定的。对这些指南中详述的所有属性和值的支持在各浏览器中都是可以互操作的。这意味着,如果你在Firefox中写了一些Grid Layout代码,它在Chrome中也应该以同样的方式工作。这不再是一个实验性的规范,你可以安全地在生产中使用它。

trans-unit.source: Other than needing to take care of items that do not fit in your subgrid, a subgrid acts very similarly to any nested grid; the only difference is that the track sizing of the subgrid is set on the parent grid. As with any nested grid however, the size of content in the subgrid can change the track sizing, assuming a track sizing method is used that allows content to affect the size. In such a case, auto-sized row tracks for example will grow to fit content in the main grid and content in the subgrid.
Other than the physical values of left and right, which relate to physical attributes of the screen, all of the other values are logical values and relate to the writing mode of the content.
trans-unit.target: 除了与屏幕的物理属性有关的 left 和 right 的物理值之外，所有其他值都是逻辑值，并且与内容的书写方式有关。

trans-unit.source: Our CSS looks like this:

Our callback cleverly calls requestAnimationFrame() a second time! This time, the callback is run before the next repaint, which is after the style recomputation has occurred. This callback adds the "changing" class back onto the box, so that the repaint will start the animation once again.
trans-unit.target: 我们的回调巧妙地再次调用 requestAnimationFrame() ！这次，在下一次重画之前（即样式重新计算之后）运行回调。该回调将 "changing" 类添加回该框，以便重新绘制将再次启动动画。

trans-unit.source: Our circle therefore accepts one radius value, which may be a length, a percentage or the closest-side or farthest side keyword then optionally the keyword at followed by a position value.
trans-unit.target: 因此，我们的圆接受一个半径值，该半径值可以是长度，百分比或最近边或最远边关键字，然后可以选择关键字at后跟位置值。

trans-unit.source: Our grid is a two-column track grid, with the column for the image sized at 1fr and the text 3fr. If you wanted a fixed width image area, then you could set the image column as a pixel width, and assign the text area 1fr. A single column track of 1fr would then take up the rest of the space.
trans-unit.target: 我们的网格是一个两列的轨道网格，图像的列大小为 1fr ，文本为 3fr 。如果需要固定宽度的图像区域，则可以将图像列设置为像素宽度，并分配文本区域 1fr 。这样一列 1fr 的轨道将占用其余空间。

trans-unit.source: Our main code sets up the event handlers on the inner box by calling addEventListener() for each of the types mouseenter, mousemove, and mouseleave.
trans-unit.target: 我们的主要代码通过为 mouseenter ， mousemove 和 mouseleave 中的每种类型调用 addEventListener() 来在内部框上设置事件处理程序。

trans-unit.source: Our new layout methods give us the ability to use these logical values to place items, however, as soon as we start to combine them with the physical properties used for margins and padding, we need to remember that those physical properties will not change according to writing mode.
trans-unit.target: 我们新的布局方法让我们有能力使用这些逻辑值来放置项目,然而,当我们开始将它们与用于页边距和padding的物理属性相结合时,我们需要记住,这些物理属性不会根据书写模式而改变。
